subject: Travel
title: The Yonaguni Monument
description: A quick win: understand The Yonaguni Monument.

hook.text: Off the coast of Japan, a diver found massive stone terraces sitting on the ocean floor.

buildup.text: The structures look like stepped pyramids with flat platforms, straight edges, and right angles.

discovery.text: Some geologists believe they are natural rock formations carved by ocean currents.

twist.text: Others argue the precision is too perfect. They say humans shaped them over 10,000 years ago.

climax.text: The debate remains unresolved. No tools or artifacts have been found nearby to settle it.

punchline.text: Nature or humans? The ocean keeps the secret.

quiz.question: What is the main debate about the Yonaguni Monument?
